snippet.title: Linkle Liver Story [リンクルリバーストーリー] Game Sample - Sega Saturn
snippet.description:
Original Air Date: December 17th, 2008

A decent Zelda-style ARPG of sorts for the Sega Saturn in Japan. Made by the same team that made "Crusaders of Centy" for the Gen/MD and sharing similar artistic direction and premise (animal-themed), the game went on to become a small cult classic. The English translation of the title is the product of Engrish and confusion, and it was never fully discovered what the actual title was supposed to be. There are various claims as to what it was meant to say or mean, but none of the claims ever really explained the matter well enough to be accepted (other than it was used as the Japanese often used some English phrases as a means of being fancy or particularly expressive, especially on products, regardless of whether or not they made sense).

The general plot is nicely summarized on Wikipedia:

"The story takes place on the planet Mamuuna (マムーナ), a world populated by anthropomorphic animals. In this world, new life is created by the "Mother Flower", which lives at the bottom of the ocean. Someone has kidnapped the Mother Flower. The player takes on the role of Kittchu (キッチュ), a rather reluctant hero who is persuaded to go on a rescue mission by the village chief."

"Kittchu is accompanied by Puchimuku (プチムク), a round pink seed-pod who insists he is not a pig. In battle, Puchimuku lunges at enemies from a distance, while Kittchu engages in hand-to-hand combat. The two travel around the world via a tornado-like wind that carries them from continent to continent."

You can upgrade weapons as you progress by using various seeds that can be augmented with droplets and solve various (mostly simple) puzzles. Your main goal will be to retrieve the Mother Flower and thwart Ongaro, an armored rat-like wizard who can manipulate and distort nature with his powers. Enjoy.
